greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=a(1)=-1, a(2)=2; thereafter a(n) = a(n-1-a(n-1))+a(n-2-a(n-2)) unless a(n-1) <= n-1 or a(n-2) <= n-2 in which case the sequence terminates.
reference: Higham, Jeff and Tanny, Stephen, A tamely chaotic meta-Fibonacci sequence. Twenty-third Manitoba Conference on Numerical Mathematics and Computing (Winnipeg, MB, 1993). Congr. Numer. 99 (1994), 67-94.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
program: where xs = map a240807 $ zipWith (-) [1..] $ tail a240807_list
xref: A006949 and A240808 have the same recurrence but different initial conditions.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 15 2014
